Introduction

Kwon Soonyoung, popularly known by his stage name Hoshi, is a South Korean dancer, singer, choreographer, songwriter and composer under Pledis Entertainment. He is the main dancer, lead vocalist and sub rapper of the boy group SEVENTEEN. Hoshi is also the leader of SVT PERFORMANCE Team and choreographs most of the group's performances. He also debuted in SVT's sub-unit BSS (BooSeokSoon).

Hoshi debuted as a member of SEVENTEEN on May 26, 2015, with the EP 17 Carat. Hoshi released his first solo mixtape, "Spider", worldwide on April 2, 2021.

Fun facts

1
Hoshi doesn't like it when he's left on "read" after sending a message. He would bug people until they reply to him.
…
2
According to Hoshi, his phone is often filled with bizarre photos of the other SEVENTEEN members.
…
3
Hoshi choreographs most of SEVENTEEN's performances.
…
4
Hoshi once broke his waterproof smartphone after having it submerged underwater.
…
5
The meaning behind his real name is that Kwon means ‘power’, Soon means ‘innocent and Young means ‘glorious’. It means be powerful by being innocent and glorious. He thinks he’s a powerful team leader for the Performance team.
…
6
Hoshi likes playing in the water.
…
7
According to Hoshi, he was the silent type back in elementary.
…
8
Hoshi is known to be a Shawol (SHINee fan), he mentioned it on Star Show360 and on other occasions. He has been a fan since he was a teenager, and he still doesn't hide the fact that he loves SHINee and that they were his inspiration to become an idol.
…
9
According to Hoshi, his nickname is "Kwon-spo" because he tends to spoil about SEVENTEEN's upcoming albums. There was even a time when his company told him not to spoil anything.
…
10
According to NCT's Doyoung, Hoshi was the most memorable Inkigayo special MC.
…
